title: What are the experiences of people under the influence of the mesmerizing gaze of Mr. Donato, and how do they describe the loss of their willpower and control over their own bodies?
first_phrase: The following text is an excerpt from a larger text about mesmerism and hypnotism. This part features testimonials from individuals who have experienced the power of a hypnotist, Monsieur Donato. The testimonials describe the intense effects of Donato's gaze, which renders his subjects powerless to resist his commands. They also mention the cataleptic states induced in them, in which they are unable to recall any of their actions. The author of the text, A. Eugene, criticizes the dogmatism of some scientists who cling to old explanations for phenomena without accounting for new discoveries. Eugene makes it clear that he is open to new ideas and to revising his understanding of mesmerism and hypnotism.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is scandalous that some doctors have copied and cited the works of Donato without giving him proper credit, despite his significant contributions to the field of hypnosis. Donato's passion and experimental prowess have been well-documented and reported on, and it is disheartening that some of his colleagues would attempt to downplay his achievements. Yet, his legacy lives on, and his impact on the field of hypnotism has been widely recognized. Let us learn from Donato's story by acknowledging the contributions of those who have come before us and continue to pave the way for future innovation.
